identificationModule.briefTitle: OPTImaL:Optimisation of Treatment for Patients With Low Stage Triple-negative Breast Cancer With High Stromal Tumor-infiltrating Lymphocytes
identificationModule.officialTitle: OPTImaL:Optimisation of Treatment for Patients With Low Stage Triple-negative Breast Cancer With High Stromal Tumor-infiltrating Lymphocytes

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study is to investigate whether subjects with breast cancer that have certain favorable features, after performing the surgery and radiation, the chemotherapy can be safely omitted in the treatment. In addition, the investigation looks at whether the omission of chemotherapy ensures a better quality of life. Participants decide, in consulatiation with their treating physician, whether they choose to be treated with adjuvant chemotherapy or not.

armGroups.label: Optimisation cohort
armGroups.description: patients will be treated with surgery and adjuvant radiotherapy following local/national guidelines, while chemotherapy will be omitted

armGroups.label: Control cohort
armGroups.description: patients will be treated with surgery, adjuvant radiotherapy and adjuvant chemotherapy following local/national guidelines

interventions.name: Adjuvant chemotherapy
interventions.description: adjuvant chemotherapy according to local/ national guidelines

primaryOutcomes.measure: Disease recurrence Free Interval (DRFI) - optimalisation cohort
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients with distant recurrence or death in optimisation cohort
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients with breast tumor recurrence or death in the optimisation cohort
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients with breast tumor recurrence or death in the control cohort
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.measure: disease recurrence free survival (DRFS) - optimalisation cohort
secondaryOutcomes.description: time between inclusion and first distant recurrence or death from any cause in the optimisation cohort
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.measure: disease recurrence free survival (DRFS) - control cohort
secondaryOutcomes.description: time between inclusion and first distant recurrence or death from any cause in the control cohort
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.description: time between inclusion and invasive ipsilateral breast tumor recurrence, local-regional invasive recurrence, distant recurrence or death from any cause in the optimisation cohort;
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.description: time between inclusion and invasive ipsilateral breast tumor recurrence, local-regional invasive recurrence, distant recurrence or death from any cause in the control cohort;
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.description: time between inclusion and death from any cause in the optimisation cohort;
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.description: time between inclusion and death from any cause in the control cohort;
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 96 months after inclusion of the last patient

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Health related Quality of Life (HRQoL) - EORTC QLQ-C30
secondaryOutcomes.description: Difference in QoL assessed with the EORTC QLQ-C30 questionnaires between the optimisation and the control group

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Health related Quality of Life (HRQoL) - EORTC QLQ-BR45
secondaryOutcomes.description: Difference in QoL assessed with the EORTC QLQ-BR45 questionnaires between the optimisation and the control group
Assessed with questionnaires to determine the difference in optimisation and control group
Assessed with questionnaires to determine the difference in optimisation and control group

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Cost effectiveness measured by quality-adjusted-life years (QALYs)
Cost effectiveness measured per incremental cost-effectiveness ratio (ICER)

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: patients with pathological stage I TNBC (pT1a/b/cN0) and a high sTIL score (defined as ≥50% for patients ≥40 years; ≥75% for patients \<40 years)
